abstract: Memo from Afghanistan; Afghan Vice Pres Abdul Rashid Dostum, frustrated by an inability to get help from his own government in effort to push back against Taliban offensive, returns to his roots as a former warlord; gathers private militias, along with police and army units, in charge against insurgents; move elicits deep concern among Afghanistan's military and political officials as well as Western diplomats.
lead_paragraph: Vice President Abdul Rashid Dostum, a former warlord, has rallied his old fighters to battle the Taliban, but some residents say his militia is just as dangerous.

headline.main: Afghan Vice President Raises Concerns by Turning to Militias in Taliban Fight
headline.print_headline: Vice President Turns Back to His Warlord Roots

snippet: Vice President Abdul Rashid Dostum, a former warlord, has rallied his old fighters to battle the Taliban, but some residents say his militia is just as dangerous.
